meaningMnemonic:
The <kanji>big</kanji> <kanji>make</kanji>! What is your big make? Bigger than anything else. It is your <vocabulary>major work</vocabulary>!

大作 means a large-scale, ambitious, or significant work. Depending on the context, it can refer to anything from an artistically accomplished <vocabulary>masterpiece</vocabulary> to a big-budget <vocabulary>blockbuster</vocabulary> movie.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since 大 has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Did you know that there's a <vocabulary>monumental work</vocabulary> about a <reading>tie</reading> <reading>sack</reading> (たいさく)? It's a <vocabulary>masterpiece</vocabulary> about a magic sack that produces tie after tie after tie after tie... A bit like The Magic Porridge Pot, but with a sack and ties instead.
